vera_determined.speaker: Narrator
vera_determined.text: Captain Vera enters the cafe with a different energy today. There's a resolve in her eyes that wasn't there before.

vera_decision.speaker: Captain Vera
vera_decision.text: I've been thinking about what you said. About courage. About running. *She stands straighter* I received word that Jonas's daughter is getting married at the coastal village.

vera_conflict.speaker: Captain Vera
vera_conflict.text: She invited me. Me! After I let her father... *She pauses* She says he would have wanted me there. That he knew the choice I faced.

choices.text: This is your chance to find peace. Jonas would want you to go.
Running from the sea was never the answer. Face it, Captain.

vera_uncertain.speaker: Captain Vera
vera_uncertain.text: Peace. *She tests the word* It's been so long since I believed that was possible. But you're right. Running hasn't brought me peace. Maybe... facing it will.

vera_challenged.speaker: Captain Vera
vera_challenged.text: *She straightens* You don't mince words. *A ghost of a smile* That's exactly what a captain needs to hear. I've been ashore too long. It's time I remembered who I am.

vera_resolve.speaker: Captain Vera
vera_resolve.text: I'm going. To the wedding. To the sea. To face what I've been hiding from. Courage isn't the absence of fear, after all. It's sailing forward anyway.

vera_courage_end.speaker: Captain Vera
vera_courage_end.text: Thank you. For this place. For listening. For reminding me what a captain is supposed to be. I'll return when I've made my peace with the tides.
